    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Simulator getInstance()

      • getCars

        public javafx.collections.ObservableList<Car> getCars()
        get observable list of cars
        Returns:
        list of car

      • addNewCar

        private void addNewCar(int carId,
                       DeviceFactory factory)
        This should be called as soon as the web app decides to make a new car
        Parameters:
        carId - eg 00 , 01, 02
        factory - a device factory instance, used to create new device for car

      • addDevice

        public void addDevice(java.lang.String deviceIdentifier)
        Add device based on input. This should be called as soon as the web app decides to add a new device
        Parameters:
        deviceIdentifier - combination of cId dId state value

      • removeDevice

        public void removeDevice(java.lang.String removeIdentifier)
        Should be called when the web app chooses to remove a device
        Parameters:
        removeIdentifier - combination of cid and did

      • getState

        public int getState(java.lang.String dataRequest)
        Should be called regularly (perhaps in a different thread) to constantly relay the current state of a device to the web app
        Parameters:
        dataRequest - combination of cid and did
        Returns:
        state of car eg 00 (off) or 01 (on)

      • getPower

        public int getPower(java.lang.String dataRequest)

      • changeState

        public void changeState(java.lang.String dataReceived)
        This should be called as soon as the web app turns on/off a device
        Parameters:
        dataReceived - ; combination of cid did and state

      • addProperty

        public void addProperty(java.lang.String commands)
        this should be called as the web app create a new property of a specified car device, or change property value
        Parameters:
        commands - combination of cid, did, property name and property value

      • getTemperature

        public int getTemperature()
        This should be called to provide real temperature.
        Returns:
        temperature of car
